instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H_CPU: What is PPBUS_G3H_CPU? PPBUS_G3H_CPU is the .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that puls 20V from ampmeter, but 0 Amp.
It had liquid contact.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area is oxidated and a few components are burnt.
<CAPACITOR>C7101</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> have blown and are gone. I supose that they may be the culprits.
<CAPACITOR>C7241</CAPACITOR> has also gone, but on the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL> pad I have 13V. How can i bypass them or solve this?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: I've tried this solution, and now i have he 13V there. Do you think it is a solid solution and enough one?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Should be good enough.
Does the board start now?
